Episodes.Title: Pilot
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: The Swamp's Korean houseboy, Ho-Jon, is accepted to attend school at Hawkeye's alma mater. The camp raises money to send Ho-Jon to Maine by raffling a weekend in Tokyo with a nurse, much to the chagrin of Hot Lips and Burns.

Episodes.Title: To Market, to Market
Episodes.Writer: Burt Styler, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: After losing vital medical supplies to black marketeers, Hawkeye and Trapper attempt to make a deal to get them back. Henry gets a new antique oak desk.

Episodes.Title: Requiem for a Lightweight
Episodes.Writer: Robert Klane, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Trapper enters the inter-camp boxing tournament.

Episodes.Title: Chief Surgeon Who?
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: When Hawkeye is appointed Chief Surgeon over Frank Burns, Burns and Houlihan go over Col. Blake's head to a general to protest the decision.

Episodes.Title: The Moose
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye is outraged when a visiting sergeant brings his 'moose' to camp - a young Korean woman he has bought to keep as his personal servant.

Episodes.Title: Yankee Doodle Doctor
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: The 4077th is chosen as the site for a documentary featuring 'false heroics' about MASH units in Korea. After destroying the film, Hawkeye and Trapper make their own movie as a replacement.

Episodes.Title: Bananas, Crackers and Nuts
Episodes.Writer: Burt Styler, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye feigns insanity to prove he needs to take leave.

Episodes.Title: Cowboy
Episodes.Writer: Robert Klane, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: A wounded "cowboy" is itching to get back to the states to keep his marriage from falling apart, but his leave request is denied. Henry Blake then becomes the target of a mad bomber.

Episodes.Title: Henry, Please Come Home
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: When Col. Henry Blake is transferred to Tokyo and Frank starts imposing military discipline on the camp, the surgeons will do anything to get Henry back.

Episodes.Title: I Hate a Mystery
Episodes.Writer: Hal Dresner, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye finds himself investigating a rash of petty thefts in the camp.

Episodes.Title: Germ Warfare
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: After tapping Frank Burns for blood, Hawkeye and Trapper's patient develops complications. They believe Frank has hepatitis and try to keep him operating.

Episodes.Title: Dear Dad
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye writes his dad, describing the antics of the 4077th.

Episodes.Title: Edwina
Episodes.Writer: Hal Dresner, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: The nurses refuse to date until their lonely colleague Edwina gets a date, so the men draw straws.

Episodes.Title: Love Story
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: After Radar gets a "Dear John" letter Hawkeye and Trapper try to help him with a new nurse who's into classical literature and music.

Episodes.Title: Tuttle
Episodes.Writer: Bruce Shelly, David Ketchum, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: A little white lie about an imaginary officer balloons into an elaborate charade.

Episodes.Title: The Ringbanger
Episodes.Writer: Jerry Mayer, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye and Trapper hit it off with a wounded Colonel, but when they discover his combat zeal is costing lives, they conspire to keep him from returning to the front line.

Episodes.Title: Sometimes You Hear the Bullet
Episodes.Writer: Carl Kleinschmitt, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye's childhood buddy drops by, and reveals that he is writing a book about his experiences in the infantry - experiences that may hit a little too close to home.

Episodes.Title: Dear Dad, Again
Episodes.Writer: Sheldon Keller, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye is bored and tired, the best time to pen another missive to his father. He describes Klinger's sheer white wedding gown, which does little to hide his white boxer shorts but is better than Hawkeye's naked dining fiasco. Th...

Episodes.Title: The Longjohn Flap
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: A cold snap has everybody trying to get their hands on Hawkeye's thermal underwear.

Episodes.Title: The Army-Navy Game
Episodes.Writer: Sid Dorfman, McLean Stevenson, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: The Army-Navy game back home holds everyone's attention (and bet money) until an artillery barrage forces the camp to dispose of an unexploded shell.

Episodes.Title: Sticky Wicket
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Richard Baer
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye moves out of the Swamp while brooding over a patient gone sour, while Frank rubs salt in the wound after suffering Hawkeye's insults to his surgical ability.

Episodes.Title: Major Fred C. Dobbs
Episodes.Writer: Sid Dorfman, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Frank applies for a transfer out of the 4077, and Hawkeye and Trapper can't resist broadcasting his goodbye to Margaret through the camp P.A. The prospect of gold in the region gives Frank second thoughts.

Episodes.Title: Ceasefire
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Robert Klane
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: The camp erupts into celebration when they receive word that there's a ceasefire.

Episodes.Title: Showtime
Episodes.Writer: Robert Klane, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: A USO troupe entertains the 4077th in between the usual chaos.
